arg.name: accounttype
arg.description: Type of the account. Specify 0 for user, 1 for root admin, and 2 for domain admin

arg.name: email
arg.description: email

arg.name: firstname
arg.description: firstname

arg.name: lastname
arg.description: lastname

arg.name: password
arg.description: Hashed password (Default is MD5). If you wish to use any other hashing algorithm, you would need to write a custom authentication adapter See Docs section.

arg.name: username
arg.description: Unique username.

arg.name: account
arg.description: Creates the user under the specified account. If no account is specified, the username will be used as the account name.

arg.name: accountdetails
arg.description: details for account used to store specific parameters

arg.name: accountid
arg.description: Account UUID, required for adding account from another Region

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: Creates the user under the specified domain.

arg.name: networkdomain
arg.description: Network domain for the account's networks

arg.name: regionid
arg.description: Id of the Region creating the account

arg.name: timezone
arg.description: Specifies a timezone for this command. For more information on the timezone parameter, see Time Zone Format.

arg.name: userid
arg.description: User UUID, required for adding account from another Region

arg.name: id
arg.description: the user ID

arg.description: the account ID of the user

arg.description: the boolean value representing if the updating target is in caller's child domain

arg.name: lastname
arg.description: the user lastname

command.name: deleteAccount
command.description: Deletes a account, and all users associated with this account

arg.name: id
arg.description: Account id

arg.name: ispropagate
arg.description: True if command is sent from another Region

arg.name: displaytext
arg.description: any text associated with the success or failure

arg.name: success
arg.description: true if operation is executed successfully

command.name: updateAccount
command.description: Updates account information for the authenticated user

arg.name: newname
arg.description: new name for the account

arg.name: account
arg.description: the current account name

arg.name: accountdetails
arg.description: details for account used to store specific parameters

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: the ID of the domain where the account exists

arg.name: id
arg.description: Account id

arg.name: ispropagate
arg.description: True if command is sent from another Region

arg.name: networkdomain
arg.description: Network domain for the account's networks; empty string will update domainName with NULL value

arg.description: the id of the account

arg.description: details for the account

arg.description: name of the Domain the account belongs too

arg.description: the total number of public ip addresses available for this account to acquire

arg.description: true if the account requires cleanup

arg.description: the name of the account

arg.description: the total number of networks available to be created for this account

arg.name: networklimit

arg.name: networktotal

command.name: listAccounts
command.description: Lists accounts and provides detailed account information for listed accounts

arg.name: accounttype
arg.description: list accounts by account type. Valid account types are 1 (admin), 2 (domain-admin), and 0 (user).

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: list only resources belonging to the domain specified

arg.name: id
arg.description: list account by account ID

arg.name: iscleanuprequired
arg.description: list accounts by cleanuprequred attribute (values are true or false)

arg.name: isrecursive
arg.description: defaults to false, but if true, lists all resources from the parent specified by the domainId till leaves.

arg.name: keyword
arg.description: List by keyword

arg.name: listall
arg.description: If set to false, list only resources belonging to the command's caller; if set to true - list resources that the caller is authorized to see. Default value is false

arg.name: name
arg.description: list account by account name

arg.name: state
arg.description: list accounts by state. Valid states are enabled, disabled, and locked.

arg.name: id
arg.description: the id of the account

arg.name: accountdetails
arg.description: details for the account

arg.description: account type (admin, domain-admin, user)

command.name: updateResourceLimit
command.description: Updates resource limits for an account or domain.

arg.name: resourcetype
arg.description: Type of resource to update. Values are 0, 1, 2, 3, and 4. 0 - Instance. Number of instances a user can create. 1 - IP. Number of public IP addresses a user can own. 2 - Volume. Number of disk volumes a user can create.3 - Snapshot. Number of snapshots a user can create.4 - Template. Number of templates that a user can register/create.

arg.name: account
arg.description: Update resource for a specified account. Must be used with the domainId parameter.

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: Update resource limits for all accounts in specified domain. If used with the account parameter, updates resource limits for a specified account in specified domain.

arg.name: max
arg.description: Maximum resource limit.

arg.name: projectid
arg.description: Update resource limits for project

arg.name: account
arg.description: the account of the resource limit

arg.name: domain
arg.description: the domain name of the resource limit

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: the domain ID of the resource limit

arg.name: max
arg.description: the maximum number of the resource. A -1 means the resource currently has no limit.

arg.name: project
arg.description: the project name of the resource limit

arg.name: projectid
arg.description: the project id of the resource limit

arg.name: resourcetype
arg.description: resource type. Values include 0, 1, 2, 3, 4. See the resourceType parameter for more information on these values.

command.name: updateResourceCount
command.description: Recalculate and update resource count for an account or domain.

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: If account parameter specified then updates resource counts for a specified account in this domain else update resource counts for all accounts & child domains in specified domain.

arg.name: account
arg.description: Update resource count for a specified account. Must be used with the domainId parameter.

arg.name: projectid
arg.description: Update resource limits for project

arg.name: resourcetype
arg.description: Type of resource to update. If specifies valid values are 0, 1, 2, 3, and 4. If not specified will update all resource counts0 - Instance. Number of instances a user can create. 1 - IP. Number of public IP addresses a user can own. 2 - Volume. Number of disk volumes a user can create.3 - Snapshot. Number of snapshots a user can create.4 - Template. Number of templates that a user can register/create.

arg.name: account
arg.description: the account for which resource count's are updated

arg.name: domain
arg.description: the domain name for which resource count's are updated

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: the domain ID for which resource count's are updated

arg.name: project
arg.description: the project name for which resource count's are updated

arg.name: projectid
arg.description: the project id for which resource count's are updated

arg.name: resourcecount
arg.description: resource count

arg.name: resourcetype
arg.description: resource type. Values include 0, 1, 2, 3, 4. See the resourceType parameter for more information on these values.

arg.name: account
arg.description: list resources by account. Must be used with the domainId parameter.

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: list only resources belonging to the domain specified

arg.name: id
arg.description: Lists resource limits by ID.

arg.name: isrecursive
arg.description: defaults to false, but if true, lists all resources from the parent specified by the domainId till leaves.

arg.name: keyword
arg.description: List by keyword

arg.name: listall
arg.description: If set to false, list only resources belonging to the command's caller; if set to true - list resources that the caller is authorized to see. Default value is false

arg.name: projectid
arg.description: list objects by project

arg.name: resourcetype
arg.description: Type of resource to update. Values are 0, 1, 2, 3, and 4. 0 - Instance. Number of instances a user can create. 1 - IP. Number of public IP addresses a user can own. 2 - Volume. Number of disk volumes a user can create.3 - Snapshot. Number of snapshots a user can create.4 - Template. Number of templates that a user can register/create.

arg.name: account
arg.description: the account of the resource limit

arg.name: domain
arg.description: the domain name of the resource limit

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: the domain ID of the resource limit

arg.description: the maximum number of the resource. A -1 means the resource currently has no limit.

command.name: deployVirtualMachine
command.description: Creates and automatically starts a virtual machine based on a service offering, disk offering, and template.

arg.name: serviceofferingid
arg.description: the ID of the service offering for the virtual machine

arg.name: templateid
arg.description: the ID of the template for the virtual machine

arg.name: zoneid
arg.description: availability zone for the virtual machine

arg.name: account
arg.description: an optional account for the virtual machine. Must be used with domainId.

arg.name: diskofferingid
arg.description: the ID of the disk offering for the virtual machine. If the template is of ISO format, the diskOfferingId is for the root disk volume. Otherwise this parameter is used to indicate the offering for the data disk volume. If the templateId parameter passed is from a Template object, the diskOfferingId refers to a DATA Disk Volume created. If the templateId parameter passed is from an ISO object, the diskOfferingId refers to a ROOT Disk Volume created.

arg.name: displayname
arg.description: an optional user generated name for the virtual machine

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: an optional domainId for the virtual machine. If the account parameter is used, domainId must also be used.

arg.name: group
arg.description: an optional group for the virtual machine

arg.name: hostid
arg.description: destination Host ID to deploy the VM to - parameter available for root admin only

arg.name: hypervisor
arg.description: the hypervisor on which to deploy the virtual machine

arg.name: ip6address
arg.description: the ipv6 address for default vm's network

arg.name: ipaddress
arg.description: the ip address for default vm's network

arg.name: iptonetworklist
arg.description: ip to network mapping. Can't be specified with networkIds parameter. Example: iptonetworklist[0].ip=10.10.10.11&iptonetworklist[0].ipv6=fc00:1234:5678::abcd&iptonetworklist[0].networkid=uuid - requests to use ip 10.10.10.11 in network id=uuid

arg.name: keyboard
arg.description: an optional keyboard device type for the virtual machine. valid value can be one of de,de-ch,es,fi,fr,fr-be,fr-ch,is,it,jp,nl-be,no,pt,uk,us

arg.name: keypair
arg.description: name of the ssh key pair used to login to the virtual machine

arg.name: name
arg.description: host name for the virtual machine

arg.name: networkids
arg.description: list of network ids used by virtual machine. Can't be specified with ipToNetworkList parameter

arg.name: projectid
arg.description: Deploy vm for the project

arg.name: securitygroupids
arg.description: comma separated list of security groups id that going to be applied to the virtual machine. Should be passed only when vm is created from a zone with Basic Network support. Mutually exclusive with securitygroupnames parameter

arg.name: securitygroupnames
arg.description: comma separated list of security groups names that going to be applied to the virtual machine. Should be passed only when vm is created from a zone with Basic Network support. Mutually exclusive with securitygroupids parameter

arg.name: size
arg.description: the arbitrary size for the DATADISK volume. Mutually exclusive with diskOfferingId

arg.name: startvm
arg.description: true if network offering supports specifying ip ranges; defaulted to true if not specified

arg.name: userdata
arg.description: an optional binary data that can be sent to the virtual machine upon a successful deployment. This binary data must be base64 encoded before adding it to the request. Currently only HTTP GET is supported. Using HTTP GET (via querystring), you can send up to 2KB of data after base64 encoding.

arg.name: id
arg.description: the ID of the virtual machine

arg.name: account
arg.description: the account associated with the virtual machine

arg.name: cpunumber
arg.description: the number of cpu this virtual machine is running with

arg.name: cpuspeed
arg.description: the speed of each cpu

arg.name: cpuused
arg.description: the amount of the vm's CPU currently used

arg.name: created
arg.description: the date when this virtual machine was created

arg.name: displayname
arg.description: user generated name. The name of the virtual machine is returned if no displayname exists.

arg.name: domain
arg.description: the name of the domain in which the virtual machine exists

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: the ID of the domain in which the virtual machine exists

arg.name: forvirtualnetwork
arg.description: the virtual network for the service offering

arg.name: group
arg.description: the group name of the virtual machine

command.name: destroyVirtualMachine
command.description: Destroys a virtual machine. Once destroyed, only the administrator can recover it.

arg.description: the number of cpu this virtual machine is running with

arg.description: the speed of each cpu

arg.description: the amount of the vm's CPU currently used

arg.description: the date when this virtual machine was created

arg.name: forced
arg.description: Force stop the VM (vm is marked as Stopped even when command fails to be send to the backend). The caller knows the VM is stopped.

arg.description: the ID of the virtual machine

arg.name: account
arg.description: the account associated with the virtual machine

arg.name: cpunumber
arg.description: the number of cpu this virtual machine is running with

arg.name: cpuspeed
arg.description: the speed of each cpu

arg.name: cpuused
arg.description: the amount of the vm's CPU currently used

arg.description: the date when this virtual machine was created

arg.description: user generated name. The name of the virtual machine is returned if no displayname exists.

arg.description: the name of the domain in which the virtual machine exists

arg.description: the virtual network for the service offering

arg.name: guestosid
arg.description: Os type ID of the virtual machine

arg.name: haenable
arg.description: true if high-availability is enabled, false otherwise

arg.name: hostid
arg.description: the ID of the host for the virtual machine

arg.name: hostname
arg.description: the name of the host for the virtual machine

arg.name: hypervisor
arg.description: the hypervisor on which the template runs

arg.name: instancename
arg.description: instance name of the user vm; this parameter is returned to the ROOT admin only

arg.description: an alternate display text of the ISO attached to the virtual machine

command.name: resetSSHKeyForVirtualMachine

arg.description: an optional account for the ssh key. Must be used with domainId.

command.name: updateVirtualMachine
command.description: Updates properties of a virtual machine. The VM has to be stopped and restarted for the new properties to take effect. UpdateVirtualMachine does not first check whether the VM is stopped. Therefore, stop the VM manually before issuing this call.

arg.name: id
arg.description: The ID of the virtual machine

arg.name: displayname
arg.description: user generated name

arg.name: group
arg.description: group of the virtual machine

arg.name: haenable
arg.description: true if high-availability is enabled for the virtual machine, false otherwise

arg.name: ostypeid
arg.description: the ID of the OS type that best represents this VM.

arg.name: userdata
arg.description: an optional binary data that can be sent to the virtual machine upon a successful deployment. This binary data must be base64 encoded before adding it to the request. Currently only HTTP GET is supported. Using HTTP GET (via querystring), you can send up to 2KB of data after base64 encoding.

arg.name: id
arg.description: the ID of the virtual machine

arg.name: account
arg.description: the account associated with the virtual machine

arg.name: cpunumber
arg.description: the number of cpu this virtual machine is running with

arg.name: cpuspeed
arg.description: the speed of each cpu

arg.name: cpuused
arg.description: the amount of the vm's CPU currently used

arg.name: created
arg.description: the date when this virtual machine was created

arg.name: displayname
arg.description: user generated name. The name of the virtual machine is returned if no displayname exists.

arg.name: domain
arg.description: the name of the domain in which the virtual machine exists

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: the ID of the domain in which the virtual machine exists

arg.name: forvirtualnetwork
arg.description: the virtual network for the service offering

arg.name: group
arg.description: the group name of the virtual machine

arg.name: groupid
arg.description: the group ID of the virtual machine

arg.name: guestosid
arg.description: Os type ID of the virtual machine

arg.name: haenable
arg.description: true if high-availability is enabled, false otherwise

arg.name: hostid
arg.description: the ID of the host for the virtual machine

arg.name: hostname
arg.description: the name of the host for the virtual machine

arg.name: hypervisor
arg.description: the hypervisor on which the template runs

arg.name: instancename
arg.description: instance name of the user vm; this parameter is returned to the ROOT admin only

arg.name: isodisplaytext
arg.description: an alternate display text of the ISO attached to the virtual machine

arg.name: isoid
arg.description: the ID of the ISO attached to the virtual machine

arg.name: isoname
arg.description: the name of the ISO attached to the virtual machine

arg.name: keypair
arg.description: ssh key-pair

arg.name: memory
arg.description: the memory allocated for the virtual machine

arg.name: name
arg.description: the name of the virtual machine

arg.name: networkkbsread
arg.description: the incoming network traffic on the vm

arg.name: networkkbswrite
arg.description: the outgoing network traffic on the host

arg.name: password
arg.description: the password (if exists) of the virtual machine

arg.name: passwordenabled
arg.description: true if the password rest feature is enabled, false otherwise

arg.name: project

arg.name: projectid

command.name: listVirtualMachines
command.description: List the virtual machines owned by the account.

arg.name: account
arg.description: list resources by account. Must be used with the domainId parameter.

arg.name: details
arg.description: comma separated list of host details requested, value can be a list of [all, group, nics, stats, secgrp, tmpl, servoff, iso, volume, min]. If no parameter is passed in, the details will be defaulted to all

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: list only resources belonging to the domain specified

arg.description: the ID of the virtual machine

arg.name: isoid
arg.description: list vms by iso

arg.name: isrecursive
arg.description: defaults to false, but if true, lists all resources from the parent specified by the domainId till leaves.

arg.name: keyword
arg.description: List by keyword

arg.name: listall
arg.description: If set to false, list only resources belonging to the command's caller; if set to true - list resources that the caller is authorized to see. Default value is false

arg.description: name of the virtual machine

arg.description: list by network id

command.name: changeServiceForVirtualMachine
command.description: Changes the service offering for a virtual machine. The virtual machine must be in a "Stopped" state for this command to take effect.

arg.name: id
arg.description: The ID of the virtual machine

arg.name: serviceofferingid
arg.description: the service offering ID to apply to the virtual machine

arg.name: id
arg.description: the ID of the virtual machine

arg.name: account
arg.description: the account associated with the virtual machine

arg.name: cpunumber
arg.description: the number of cpu this virtual machine is running with

arg.name: cpuspeed
arg.description: the speed of each cpu

arg.name: cpuused
arg.description: the amount of the vm's CPU currently used

arg.name: created
arg.description: the date when this virtual machine was created

arg.name: displayname
arg.description: user generated name. The name of the virtual machine is returned if no displayname exists.

arg.name: domain
arg.description: the name of the domain in which the virtual machine exists

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: the ID of the domain in which the virtual machine exists

arg.name: forvirtualnetwork
arg.description: the virtual network for the service offering

arg.name: group
arg.description: the group name of the virtual machine

arg.name: groupid
arg.description: the group ID of the virtual machine

arg.name: guestosid
arg.description: Os type ID of the virtual machine

arg.name: haenable
arg.description: true if high-availability is enabled, false otherwise

arg.name: hostid
arg.description: the ID of the host for the virtual machine

arg.name: hostname
arg.description: the name of the host for the virtual machine

arg.name: hypervisor
arg.description: the hypervisor on which the template runs

arg.name: instancename
arg.description: instance name of the user vm; this parameter is returned to the ROOT admin only

arg.name: isodisplaytext
arg.description: an alternate display text of the ISO attached to the virtual machine

arg.name: isoid
arg.description: the ID of the ISO attached to the virtual machine

arg.name: isoname
arg.description: the name of the ISO attached to the virtual machine

arg.name: keypair
arg.description: ssh key-pair

arg.name: memory
arg.description: the memory allocated for the virtual machine

arg.name: name
arg.description: the name of the virtual machine

arg.name: networkkbsread
arg.description: the incoming network traffic on the vm

arg.name: networkkbswrite
arg.description: the outgoing network traffic on the host

arg.name: password
arg.description: the password (if exists) of the virtual machine

arg.name: passwordenabled
arg.description: true if the password rest feature is enabled, false otherwise

arg.name: project
arg.description: the project name of the vm

arg.name: projectid
arg.description: the project id of the vm

arg.name: publicip
arg.description: public IP address id associated with vm via Static nat rule

arg.name: publicipid
arg.description: public IP address id associated with vm via Static nat rule

arg.name: rootdeviceid
arg.description: device ID of the root volume

arg.name: rootdevicetype
arg.description: device type of the root volume

arg.name: serviceofferingname
arg.description: the name of the service offering of the virtual machine

arg.name: state

command.name: createSnapshot
command.description: Creates an instant snapshot of a volume.

arg.name: volumeid
arg.description: The ID of the disk volume

arg.name: account
arg.description: The account of the snapshot. The account parameter must be used with the domainId parameter.

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: The domain ID of the snapshot. If used with the account parameter, specifies a domain for the account associated with the disk volume.

arg.name: policyid
arg.description: policy id of the snapshot, if this is null, then use MANUAL_POLICY.

arg.name: id
arg.description: ID of the snapshot

arg.name: account
arg.description: the account associated with the snapshot

arg.name: created
arg.description: the date the snapshot was created

arg.name: domain
arg.description: the domain name of the snapshot's account

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: the domain ID of the snapshot's account

arg.name: intervaltype
arg.description: valid types are hourly, daily, weekly, monthy, template, and none.

arg.name: name
arg.description: name of the snapshot

arg.name: project
arg.description: the project name of the snapshot

arg.name: projectid
arg.description: the project id of the snapshot

arg.name: snapshottype
arg.description: the type of the snapshot

arg.name: state
arg.description: the state of the snapshot. BackedUp means that snapshot is ready to be used; Creating - the snapshot is being allocated on the primary storage; BackingUp - the snapshot is being backed up on secondary storage

arg.name: volumeid
arg.description: ID of the disk volume

arg.name: volumename
arg.description: name of the disk volume

arg.name: volumetype
arg.description: type of the disk volume

arg.name: tags(*)
arg.description: the list of resource tags associated with snapshot

arg.name: customer

arg.description: time the snapshot is scheduled to be taken.

arg.name: timezone
arg.description: the time zone of the snapshot policy

arg.description: the ID of the disk volume

command.name: createTemplate
command.description: Creates a template of a virtual machine. The virtual machine must be in a STOPPED state. A template created from this command is automatically designated as a private template visible to the account that created it.

arg.name: displaytext
arg.description: the display text of the template. This is usually used for display purposes.

arg.name: name
arg.description: the name of the template

arg.name: ostypeid
arg.description: the ID of the OS Type that best represents the OS of this template.

arg.name: bits
arg.description: 32 or 64 bit

arg.name: details
arg.description: Template details in key/value pairs.

arg.name: isfeatured
arg.description: true if this template is a featured template, false otherwise

arg.name: ispublic
arg.description: true if this template is a public template, false otherwise

arg.name: passwordenabled
arg.description: true if the template supports the password reset feature; default is false

arg.name: requireshvm
arg.description: true if the template requres HVM, false otherwise

arg.name: snapshotid
arg.description: the ID of the snapshot the template is being created from. Either this parameter, or volumeId has to be passed in

arg.name: templatetag
arg.description: the tag for this template.

arg.name: url
arg.description: Optional, only for baremetal hypervisor. The directory name where template stored on CIFS server

arg.name: virtualmachineid
arg.description: Optional, VM ID. If this presents, it is going to create a baremetal template for VM this ID refers to. This is only for VM whose hypervisor type is BareMetal

arg.name: volumeid
arg.description: the ID of the disk volume the template is being created from. Either this parameter, or snapshotId has to be passed in

arg.name: id
arg.description: the ID of the storage pool

arg.name: clusterid
arg.description: the ID of the cluster for the storage pool

arg.name: clustername
arg.description: the name of the cluster for the storage pool

arg.name: created
arg.description: the date and time the storage pool was created

arg.name: disksizeallocated
arg.description: the host's currently allocated disk size

arg.name: disksizetotal
arg.description: the total disk size of the storage pool

arg.name: disksizeused
arg.description: the host's currently used disk size

arg.name: ipaddress
arg.description: the IP address of the storage pool

arg.name: name
arg.description: the name of the storage pool

arg.name: path
arg.description: the storage pool path

arg.name: podid
arg.description: the Pod ID of the storage pool

arg.name: podname
arg.description: the Pod name of the storage pool

arg.name: state
arg.description: the state of the storage pool

arg.name: tags
arg.description: the tags for the storage pool

arg.name: type
arg.description: the storage pool type

arg.name: zoneid
arg.description: the Zone ID of the storage pool

arg.name: zonename
arg.description: the Zone name of the storage pool

arg.name: jobid
arg.description: the ID of the latest async job acting on this object

arg.name: jobstatus
arg.description: the current status of the latest async job acting on this object

command.name: registerTemplate
command.description: Registers an existing template into the CloudStack cloud.

arg.name: displaytext
arg.description: the display text of the template. This is usually used for display purposes.

arg.name: format
arg.description: the format for the template. Possible values include QCOW2, RAW, and VHD.

arg.name: hypervisor
arg.description: the target hypervisor for the template

arg.name: name
arg.description: the name of the template

arg.name: ostypeid
arg.description: the ID of the OS Type that best represents the OS of this template.

arg.name: url
arg.description: the URL of where the template is hosted. Possible URL include http:// and https://

arg.name: zoneid
arg.description: the ID of the zone the template is to be hosted on

arg.name: account
arg.description: an optional accountName. Must be used with domainId.

arg.name: bits
arg.description: 32 or 64 bits support. 64 by default

arg.name: checksum
arg.description: the MD5 checksum value of this template

arg.name: details
arg.description: Template details in key/value pairs.

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: an optional domainId. If the account parameter is used, domainId must also be used.

arg.name: isextractable
arg.description: true if the template or its derivatives are extractable; default is false

arg.name: isfeatured
arg.description: true if this template is a featured template, false otherwise

arg.name: ispublic
arg.description: true if the template is available to all accounts; default is true

arg.name: passwordenabled
arg.description: true if the template supports the password reset feature; default is false

arg.name: projectid
arg.description: Register template for the project

arg.name: requireshvm
arg.description: true if this template requires HVM

arg.name: sshkeyenabled
arg.description: true if the template supports the sshkey upload feature; default is false

arg.name: templatetag
arg.description: the tag for this template.

arg.name: id
arg.description: the template ID

arg.name: account
arg.description: the account name to which the template belongs

arg.name: accountid
arg.description: the account id to which the template belongs

arg.name: bootable
arg.description: true if the ISO is bootable, false otherwise

arg.name: checksum
arg.description: checksum of the template

arg.name: created
arg.description: the date this template was created

arg.name: crossZones
arg.description: true if the template is managed across all Zones, false otherwise

arg.name: details
arg.description: additional key/value details tied with template

arg.name: displaytext
arg.description: the template display text

arg.name: domain
arg.description: the name of the domain to which the template belongs

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: the ID of the domain to which the template belongs

arg.name: format
arg.description: the format of the template.

arg.name: hostid
arg.description: the ID of the secondary storage host for the template

arg.name: hostname
arg.description: the name of the secondary storage host for the template

arg.name: hypervisor
arg.description: the hypervisor on which the template runs

arg.name: isextractable
arg.description: true if the template is extractable, false otherwise

arg.name: isfeatured
arg.description: true if this template is a featured template, false otherwise

arg.name: ispublic
arg.description: true if this template is a public template, false otherwise

arg.name: isready
arg.description: true if the template is ready to be deployed from, false otherwise.

arg.name: name
arg.description: the template name

arg.name: ostypeid
arg.description: the ID of the OS type for this template.

arg.name: ostypename
arg.description: the name of the OS type for this template.

arg.name: passwordenabled
arg.description: true if the reset password feature is enabled, false otherwise

arg.name: project
arg.description: the project name of the template

arg.name: projectid
arg.description: the project id of the template

arg.name: removed
arg.description: the date this template was removed

arg.name: size
arg.description: the size of the template

arg.name: sourcetemplateid
arg.description: the template ID of the parent template if present

arg.name: sshkeyenabled
arg.description: true if template is sshkey enabled, false otherwise

arg.name: status
arg.description: the status of the template

arg.name: templatetag
arg.description: the tag of this template

arg.name: templatetype
arg.description: the type of the template

arg.name: zoneid
arg.description: the ID of the zone for this template

arg.name: zonename
arg.description: the name of the zone for this template

arg.description: the list of resource tags associated with tempate

arg.description: the account associated with the tag

arg.name: customer
arg.description: customer associated with the tag

command.name: listTemplates
command.description: List all public, private, and privileged templates.

arg.name: templatefilter
arg.description: possible values are "featured", "self", "self-executable", "executable", and "community".* featured-templates that are featured and are public* self-templates that have been registered/created by the owner* selfexecutable-templates that have been registered/created by the owner that can be used to deploy a new VM* executable-all templates that can be used to deploy a new VM* community-templates that are public.

command.name: updateTemplatePermissions
command.description: Updates a template visibility permissions. A public template is visible to all accounts within the same domain. A private template is visible only to the owner of the template. A priviledged template is a private template with account permissions added. Only accounts specified under the template permissions are visible to them.

arg.name: id
arg.description: the template ID

arg.name: accounts
arg.description: a comma delimited list of accounts. If specified, "op" parameter has to be passed in.

arg.name: isextractable
arg.description: true if the template/iso is extractable, false other wise. Can be set only by root admin

arg.name: isfeatured
arg.description: true for featured template/iso, false otherwise

arg.name: ispublic
arg.description: true for public template/iso, false for private templates/isos

arg.name: op
arg.description: permission operator (add, remove, reset)

arg.name: projectids
arg.description: a comma delimited list of projects. If specified, "op" parameter has to be passed in.

arg.name: displaytext
arg.description: any text associated with the success or failure

arg.name: success
arg.description: true if operation is executed successfully

command.name: attachIso
command.description: Attaches an ISO to a virtual machine.

arg.name: id
arg.description: the ID of the ISO file

arg.name: virtualmachineid
arg.description: the ID of the virtual machine

arg.name: id
arg.description: the ID of the virtual machine

arg.name: account
arg.description: the account associated with the virtual machine

arg.name: cpunumber
arg.description: the number of cpu this virtual machine is running with

arg.name: cpuspeed
arg.description: the speed of each cpu

arg.name: cpuused
arg.description: the amount of the vm's CPU currently used

arg.name: created
arg.description: the date when this virtual machine was created

arg.name: displayname
arg.description: user generated name. The name of the virtual machine is returned if no displayname exists.

arg.name: domain
arg.description: the name of the domain in which the virtual machine exists

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: the ID of the domain in which the virtual machine exists

arg.name: forvirtualnetwork
arg.description: the virtual network for the service offering

arg.name: group
arg.description: the group name of the virtual machine

arg.name: groupid
arg.description: the group ID of the virtual machine

arg.name: guestosid
arg.description: Os type ID of the virtual machine

arg.name: haenable
arg.description: true if high-availability is enabled, false otherwise

arg.name: hostid
arg.description: the ID of the host for the virtual machine

arg.name: hostname
arg.description: the name of the host for the virtual machine

arg.name: hypervisor
arg.description: the hypervisor on which the template runs

arg.name: instancename
arg.description: instance name of the user vm; this parameter is returned to the ROOT admin only

arg.name: isodisplaytext
arg.description: an alternate display text of the ISO attached to the virtual machine

arg.description: the ID of the ISO attached to the virtual machine

arg.name: isoname
arg.description: the name of the ISO attached to the virtual machine

arg.name: keypair
arg.description: ssh key-pair

arg.name: memory
arg.description: the memory allocated for the virtual machine

arg.name: name
arg.description: the name of the virtual machine

arg.name: networkkbsread
arg.description: the incoming network traffic on the vm

arg.name: networkkbswrite
arg.description: the outgoing network traffic on the host

arg.name: password
arg.description: the password (if exists) of the virtual machine

arg.name: passwordenabled
arg.description: true if the password rest feature is enabled, false otherwise

arg.name: project
arg.description: the project name of the vm

arg.name: projectid
arg.description: the project id of the vm

arg.name: publicip
arg.description: public IP address id associated with vm via Static nat rule

arg.name: publicipid
arg.description: public IP address id associated with vm via Static nat rule

arg.name: rootdeviceid

command.name: detachIso
command.description: Detaches any ISO file (if any) currently attached to a virtual machine.

command.name: associateIpAddress
command.description: Acquires and associates a public IP to an account.

arg.description: the account to associate with this IP address

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: the ID of the domain to associate with this IP address

arg.name: networkid
arg.description: The network this ip address should be associated to.

arg.name: projectid
arg.description: Deploy vm for the project

arg.name: vpcid
arg.description: the VPC you want the ip address to be associated with

arg.name: zoneid
arg.description: the ID of the availability zone you want to acquire an public IP address from

arg.name: id
arg.description: public IP address id

arg.name: account
arg.description: the account the public IP address is associated with

arg.name: allocated
arg.description: date the public IP address was acquired

arg.name: associatednetworkid
arg.description: the ID of the Network associated with the IP address

arg.name: associatednetworkname
arg.description: the name of the Network associated with the IP address

arg.name: domain
arg.description: the domain the public IP address is associated with

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: the domain ID the public IP address is associated with

arg.name: forvirtualnetwork
arg.description: the virtual network for the IP address

arg.name: ipaddress
arg.description: public IP address

arg.name: issourcenat
arg.description: true if the IP address is a source nat address, false otherwise

arg.name: isstaticnat
arg.description: true if this ip is for static nat, false otherwise

arg.name: issystem
arg.description: true if this ip is system ip (was allocated as a part of deployVm or createLbRule)

arg.name: networkid
arg.description: the ID of the Network where ip belongs to

arg.name: physicalnetworkid
arg.description: the physical network this belongs to

arg.name: project

arg.name: projectid
arg.description: the project id of the ipaddress

arg.name: purpose
arg.description: purpose of the IP address. In Acton this value is not null for Ips with isSystem=true, and can have either StaticNat or LB value

arg.name: state
arg.description: State of the ip address. Can be: Allocatin, Allocated and Releasing

arg.name: virtualmachinedisplayname
arg.description: virutal machine display name the ip address is assigned to (not null only for static nat Ip)

arg.name: virtualmachineid
arg.description: virutal machine id the ip address is assigned to (not null only for static nat Ip)

arg.name: virtualmachinename
arg.description: virutal machine name the ip address is assigned to (not null only for static nat Ip)

arg.description: the ID of the VLAN associated with the IP address. This parameter is visible to ROOT admins only

arg.description: VPC the ip belongs to

arg.description: the name of the zone the public IP address belongs to

arg.name: serviceofferingname
arg.description: the name of the service offering of the virtual machine

arg.name: state
arg.description: the state of the virtual machine

arg.name: templatedisplaytext
arg.description: an alternate display text of the template for the virtual machine

arg.name: templateid
arg.description: the ID of the template for the virtual machine. A -1 is returned if the virtual machine was created from an ISO file.

arg.description: the name of the template for the virtual machine

arg.name: zoneid
arg.description: the ID of the availablility zone for the virtual machine

arg.name: zonename
arg.description: the name of the availability zone for the virtual machine

arg.name: nic(*)
arg.description: the list of nics associated with vm

arg.name: id

arg.name: broadcasturi
arg.description: the broadcast uri of the nic

arg.name: gateway
arg.description: the gateway of the nic

arg.name: ip6address
arg.description: the IPv6 address of network

arg.name: ip6cidr
arg.description: the cidr of IPv6 network

arg.name: ip6gateway
arg.description: the gateway of IPv6 network

arg.name: ipaddress
arg.description: the ip address of the nic

arg.name: isdefault
arg.description: true if nic is default, false otherwise

arg.name: isolationuri
arg.description: the isolation uri of the nic

arg.name: macaddress
arg.description: true if nic is default, false otherwise

arg.name: netmask
arg.description: the netmask of the nic

arg.name: networkid
arg.description: the ID of the corresponding network

arg.name: networkname

arg.name: traffictype
arg.description: the traffic type of the nic

arg.name: type

command.name: createAutoScalePolicy
command.description: Creates an autoscale policy for a provision or deprovision action, the action is taken when the all the conditions evaluates to true for the specified duration. The policy is in effect once it is attached to a autscale vm group.

arg.name: action
arg.description: the action to be executed if all the conditions evaluate to true for the specified duration.

arg.name: conditionids
arg.description: the list of IDs of the conditions that are being evaluated on every interval

arg.name: duration
arg.description: the duration for which the conditions have to be true before action is taken

arg.name: quiettime
arg.description: the cool down period for which the policy should not be evaluated after the action has been taken

arg.name: id
arg.description: the autoscale policy ID

arg.name: account
arg.description: the account owning the autoscale policy

arg.name: action
arg.description: the action to be executed if all the conditions evaluate to true for the specified duration.

arg.name: conditions
arg.description: the list of IDs of the conditions that are being evaluated on every interval

arg.name: domain
arg.description: the domain name of the autoscale policy

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: the domain ID of the autoscale policy

arg.name: duration
arg.description: the duration for which the conditions have to be true before action is taken

arg.name: project
arg.description: the project name of the autoscale policy

arg.name: projectid
arg.description: the project id autoscale policy

arg.name: quiettime
arg.description: the cool down period for which the policy should not be evaluated after the action has been taken

command.name: createAutoScaleVmProfile
command.description: Creates a profile that contains information about the virtual machine which will be provisioned automatically by autoscale feature.

arg.name: serviceofferingid
arg.description: the service offering of the auto deployed virtual machine

arg.name: templateid
arg.description: the template of the auto deployed virtual machine

arg.name: zoneid
arg.description: availability zone for the auto deployed virtual machine

arg.name: autoscaleuserid
arg.description: the ID of the user used to launch and destroy the VMs

arg.name: counterparam
arg.description: counterparam list. Example: counterparam[0].name=snmpcommunity&counterparam[0].value=public&counterparam[1].name=snmpport&counterparam[1].value=161

arg.name: destroyvmgraceperiod
arg.description: the time allowed for existing connections to get closed before a vm is destroyed

arg.name: otherdeployparams
arg.description: parameters other than zoneId/serviceOfferringId/templateId of the auto deployed virtual machine

arg.name: id
arg.description: the autoscale vm profile ID

arg.name: account
arg.description: the account owning the instance group

arg.name: autoscaleuserid
arg.description: the ID of the user used to launch and destroy the VMs

arg.name: destroyvmgraceperiod
arg.description: the time allowed for existing connections to get closed before a vm is destroyed

arg.name: domain
arg.description: the domain name of the vm profile

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: the domain ID of the vm profile

arg.name: otherdeployparams
arg.description: parameters other than zoneId/serviceOfferringId/templateId to be used while deploying a virtual machine

arg.name: project
arg.description: the project name of the vm profile

arg.name: projectid
arg.description: the project id vm profile

arg.description: the service offering to be used while deploying a virtual machine

arg.name: templateid
arg.description: the template to be used while deploying a virtual machine

arg.name: zoneid
arg.description: the availability zone to be used while deploying a virtual machine

command.name: updateAutoScaleVmGroup
command.description: Updates an existing autoscale vm group.

arg.name: id
arg.description: the ID of the autoscale group

arg.name: interval
arg.description: the frequency at which the conditions have to be evaluated

arg.name: maxmembers
arg.description: the maximum number of members in the vmgroup, The number of instances in the vm group will be equal to or less than this number.

arg.name: minmembers
arg.description: the minimum number of members in the vmgroup, the number of instances in the vm group will be equal to or more than this number.

arg.name: scaledownpolicyids
arg.description: list of scaledown autoscale policies

arg.name: scaleuppolicyids
arg.description: list of scaleup autoscale policies

arg.name: lbruleid
arg.description: the load balancer rule ID

command.name: ldapConfig
command.description: Configure the LDAP context for this site.

arg.name: hostname
arg.description: Hostname or ip address of the ldap server eg: my.ldap.com

arg.name: queryfilter
arg.description: You specify a query filter here, which narrows down the users, who can be part of this domain.

arg.name: searchbase
arg.description: The search base defines the starting point for the search in the directory tree Example: dc=cloud,dc=com.

arg.name: binddn
arg.description: Specify the distinguished name of a user with the search permission on the directory.

arg.name: bindpass
arg.description: Enter the password.

arg.name: port
arg.description: Specify the LDAP port if required, default is 389.

arg.name: ssl
arg.description: Check Use SSL if the external LDAP server is configured for LDAP over SSL.

arg.name: truststore
arg.description: Enter the path to trust certificates store.

arg.name: truststorepass
arg.description: Enter the password for trust store.

arg.name: binddn
arg.description: Specify the distinguished name of a user with the search permission on the directory

arg.name: bindpass
arg.description: DN password

arg.name: hostname
arg.description: Hostname or ip address of the ldap server eg: my.ldap.com

arg.name: port
arg.description: Specify the LDAP port if required, default is 389

arg.name: port
arg.description: Check Use SSL if the external LDAP server is configured for LDAP over SSL

arg.name: queryfilter
arg.description: You specify a query filter here, which narrows down the users, who can be part of this domain

arg.name: searchbase
arg.description: The search base defines the starting point for the search in the directory tree Example: dc=cloud,dc=com

command.name: ldapRemove
command.description: Remove the LDAP context for this site.

arg.name: binddn
arg.description: Specify the distinguished name of a user with the search permission on the directory

arg.name: bindpass
arg.description: DN password

arg.name: hostname
arg.description: Hostname or ip address of the ldap server eg: my.ldap.com

arg.name: port
arg.description: Specify the LDAP port if required, default is 389

arg.name: port
arg.description: Check Use SSL if the external LDAP server is configured for LDAP over SSL

arg.name: queryfilter
arg.description: You specify a query filter here, which narrows down the users, who can be part of this domain

arg.name: searchbase
arg.description: The search base defines the starting point for the search in the directory tree Example: dc=cloud,dc=com

arg.description: true if regular user is allowed to create projects

arg.name: cloudstackversion
arg.description: version of the cloud stack

arg.description: maximum size that can be specified when create disk from disk offering with custom size

arg.description: true if security groups support is enabled, false otherwise

arg.description: true if region supports elastic load balancer on basic zones

arg.description: true if user and domain admins can set templates to be shared, false otherwise

arg.description: List by keyword

arg.description: the event level (INFO, WARN, ERROR)

arg.description: a brief description of the event

arg.description: list by alert type

arg.description: One of the following alert types: MEMORY = 0, CPU = 1, STORAGE = 2, STORAGE_ALLOCATED = 3, PUBLIC_IP = 4, PRIVATE_IP = 5, HOST = 6, USERVM = 7, DOMAIN_ROUTER = 8, CONSOLE_PROXY = 9, ROUTING = 10: lost connection to default route (to the gateway), STORAGE_MISC = 11: lost connection to default route (to the gateway), USAGE_SERVER = 12: lost connection to default route (to the gateway), MANAGMENT_NODE = 13: lost connection to default route (to the gateway), DOMAIN_ROUTER_MIGRATE = 14, CONSOLE_PROXY_MIGRATE = 15, USERVM_MIGRATE = 16, VLAN = 17, SSVM = 18, USAGE_SERVER_RESULT = 19

command.name: updateHostPassword
command.description: Update password of a host/pool on management server.

arg.name: password
arg.description: the new password for the host/cluster

arg.name: username
arg.description: the username for the host/cluster

arg.name: clusterid
arg.description: the cluster ID

arg.name: hostid
arg.description: the host ID

arg.name: displaytext
arg.description: any text associated with the success or failure

arg.name: success
arg.description: true if operation is executed successfully

command.name: attachVolume
command.description: Attaches a disk volume to a virtual machine.

arg.name: id
arg.description: the ID of the disk volume

arg.name: virtualmachineid
arg.description: the ID of the virtual machine

arg.name: deviceid
arg.description: the ID of the device to map the volume to within the guest OS. If no deviceId is passed in, the next available deviceId will be chosen. Possible values for a Linux OS are:* 1 - /dev/xvdb* 2 - /dev/xvdc* 4 - /dev/xvde* 5 - /dev/xvdf* 6 - /dev/xvdg* 7 - /dev/xvdh* 8 - /dev/xvdi* 9 - /dev/xvdj

arg.name: id
arg.description: ID of the disk volume

arg.name: account
arg.description: the account associated with the disk volume

arg.name: attached
arg.description: the date the volume was attached to a VM instance

arg.name: created
arg.description: the date the disk volume was created

arg.name: destroyed
arg.description: the boolean state of whether the volume is destroyed or not

arg.name: deviceid
arg.description: the ID of the device on user vm the volume is attahed to. This tag is not returned when the volume is detached.

arg.name: diskofferingdisplaytext
arg.description: the display text of the disk offering

arg.name: diskofferingid
arg.description: ID of the disk offering

arg.name: diskofferingname
arg.description: name of the disk offering

arg.name: domain
arg.description: the domain associated with the disk volume

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: the ID of the domain associated with the disk volume

arg.name: hypervisor
arg.description: Hypervisor the volume belongs to

arg.name: isextractable
arg.description: true if the volume is extractable, false otherwise

arg.name: name
arg.description: name of the disk volume

arg.name: project
arg.description: the project name of the vpn

arg.name: projectid
arg.description: the project id of the vpn

arg.name: serviceofferingdisplaytext
arg.description: the display text of the service offering for root disk

arg.name: serviceofferingid

command.name: createVolume
command.description: Creates a disk volume from a disk offering. This disk volume must still be attached to a virtual machine to make use of it.

arg.description: the ID of the disk offering. Either diskOfferingId or snapshotId must be passed in.

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: the domain ID associated with the disk offering. If used with the account parameter returns the disk volume associated with the account for the specified domain.

arg.name: projectid
arg.description: the project associated with the volume. Mutually exclusive with account parameter

command.name: registerUserKeys
command.description: This command allows a user to register for the developer API, returning a secret key and an API key. This request is made through the integration API port, so it is a privileged command and must be made on behalf of a user. It is up to the implementer just how the username and password are entered, and then how that translates to an integration API request. Both secret key and API key should be returned to the user

arg.name: id
arg.description: User id

arg.name: apikey
arg.description: the api key of the registered user

arg.name: secretkey
arg.description: the secret key of the registered user

command.name: queryAsyncJobResult
command.description: Retrieves the current status of asynchronous job.

arg.name: jobid
arg.description: the ID of the asychronous job

arg.name: accountid
arg.description: the account that executed the async command

arg.name: cmd
arg.description: the async command executed

arg.name: created
arg.description: the created date of the job

arg.name: jobinstanceid
arg.description: the unique ID of the instance/entity object related to the job

arg.name: jobinstancetype
arg.description: the instance/entity object related to the job

arg.name: jobprocstatus
arg.description: the progress information of the PENDING job

arg.name: jobresult
arg.description: the result reason

arg.name: jobresultcode
arg.description: the result code for the job

arg.name: jobresulttype
arg.description: the result type

command.name: uploadCustomCertificate
command.description: Uploads a custom certificate for the console proxy VMs to use for SSL. Can be used to upload a single certificate signed by a known CA. Can also be used, through multiple calls, to upload a chain of certificates from CA to the custom certificate itself.

arg.name: certificate
arg.description: The certificate to be uploaded.

arg.name: domainsuffix
arg.description: DNS domain suffix that the certificate is granted for.

arg.name: id
arg.description: An integer providing the location in a chain that the certificate will hold. Usually, this can be left empty. When creating a chain, the top level certificate should have an ID of 1, with each step in the chain incrementing by one. Example, CA with id = 1, Intermediate CA with id = 2, Site certificate with ID = 3

arg.name: message
arg.description: message of the certificate upload operation

arg.description: the zone id for listing hypervisors.

arg.name: name
arg.description: Hypervisor name

command.name: restartNetwork
command.description: Restarts the network; includes 1) restarting network elements - virtual routers, dhcp servers 2) reapplying all public ips 3) reapplying loadBalancing/portForwarding rules

arg.description: If cleanup old network elements

arg.description: type of the icmp message being sent

command.name: generateUsageRecords
command.description: Generates usage records. This will generate records only if there any records to be generated, i.e if the scheduled usage job was not run or failed

arg.name: enddate
arg.description: End date range for usage record query. Use yyyy-MM-dd as the date format, e.g. startDate=2009-06-03.

arg.name: startdate
arg.description: Start date range for usage record query. Use yyyy-MM-dd as the date format, e.g. startDate=2009-06-01.

arg.description: List events for the specified domain.

arg.name: displaytext
arg.description: any text associated with the success or failure

arg.name: success

command.name: login
command.description: Logs a user into the CloudStack. A successful login attempt will generate a JSESSIONID cookie value that can be passed in subsequent Query command calls until the "logout" command has been issued or the session has expired.

arg.name: username
arg.description: Username

arg.name: password
arg.description: Hashed password (Default is MD5). If you wish to use any other hashing algorithm, you would need to write a custom authentication adapter See Docs section.

arg.name: domain
arg.description: path of the domain that the user belongs to. Example: domain=/com/cloud/internal. If no domain is passed in, the ROOT domain is assumed.

arg.name: domainId
arg.description: id of the domain that the user belongs to. If both domain and domainId are passed in, "domainId" parameter takes precendence

arg.name: username
arg.description: Username

arg.name: userid
arg.description: User id

arg.name: password
arg.description: Password

arg.name: domainid
arg.description: domain ID that the user belongs to

arg.name: timeout
arg.description: the time period before the session has expired

arg.name: account
arg.description: the account name the user belongs to

arg.name: firstname
arg.description: first name of the user

arg.name: lastname
arg.description: last name of the user

arg.name: type
arg.description: the account type (admin, domain-admin, read-only-admin, user)

arg.name: timezone
arg.description: user time zone

arg.name: timezoneoffset
arg.description: user time zone offset from UTC 00:00

arg.name: sessionkey
arg.description: Session key that can be passed in subsequent Query command calls

arg.name: description
arg.description: success if the logout action succeeded
